reference.ref: C. E. Brodley and M. A. Friedl, “Identifying Mislabeled Training Data”, Journal of Artificial Intelligence Research, vol. 11, pp. 131–167, 1999.

generalDescription.objective: To remove noisy instances from the training data.
generalDescription.howWork:
The process carried out by the Ensemble Filter is described below:
1) Split the training data into n equal sized parts. 2) For each of these n parts, m filter algorithms are trained on the other n − 1 parts. 3) The m resulting classifiers are then used to tag each instance in the excluded part as either correct or mislabeled, by comparing the training label with that assigned by the classifier. 4) Decide which instances must be removed from the training set by means a vote-based scheme.

parameterSpec.param: numPartitions: number of partitions of the training set.
numNeighbors: for the K-NN algorithm, the number of neighbors.
distanceType: for the K-NN algorithm, the distance type.
confidence: confidence for the C4.5 algorithm.
itemsetsPerLeaf: minimum of itemsets per leaf for the C4.5 algorithm.
